Package ie.gmit.sw

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Poisonable
    Interface that contains purely declarative methods
    Resultable
    Interface that contains purely declarative methods
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Consumer
    Consumer threads that are responsible for taking results from the Blocking Queue and incrementing a Synchronised counter
    Decryptor
    Responsible for putting result objects onto the BlockingQueue
    FileParser
    Reads the Key Value pairs from the 4grams.txt into a ConcurrentHashMap
    PoisonResult
    Deals with Poisoning a Blocking Queue, that effectively stops it
    QuadGramMap
    Statically declares a Quad Gram Size of 4, the size of each Key in the 4grams.txt file
    RailFence
    Basic implementation of the Rail Fence Cypher using a 2D char array Note that there are more efficient ways to encrypt and decrypt, but the following implementation illustrates the steps involved in each process and shows how the zig-zagging works.
    Result
    Creates a Result object that contains best match plain text, key and score of the decryption effort
    Runner
    The application Runner that contains the main method
    TextScorer
    Compares each quad gram from the 4grams.txt with the Result returned from the decryption effort and scores accordingly
